content.description: Start just left of the obvious "Acme" crack that finishes at the bolt anchor. Follow the left-tending, disjointed crack system that has several pockets, and stay right of the two chockstones. The crux is just below the second chockstone, which can be slung with a runner for protection. Pull the upper, flared crack (crux), and reach for secure holds within the horizontal crack. Â The climb finishes using the many (crimpy) quartz crystals on the upper face.
content.protection: Gear up to 2", & a runner to sling the upper chockstone, or TR from the "Acme" bolt anchor.
content.location: The disjointed crack system with several pockets that stays right of the two chockstones within The Den.

content.description: This straightforward route follows a big, zig-zagging crack system inside the 'Den'. Follow jugs in the crack to the top. An easy solo, and one of the quickest ways to get from the base of the crag to the top.
content.protection: The crack would take pro, but is dirty. Two bolt anchor at the top. If soloing, the wall behind the climb is a safety net of sorts because if you managed to fall, you could chimney against it.
content.location: Inside the large fissure between Desperado and Building Blocks. Access the chimney through a tunnel at the lower left side of Desperado. A cool spot on a summer's day.

content.description: This is a 30 foot crag that faces north. It has a nice chimney climb. Gear is useful for anchors. There are some bolt anchors as well, now.L->R:A. Scylla & Charybdis, 9+.B1. Crystal Ship/Shop, 7+, 1p, 30', TR or gear.B2. Acme Krak Climbing Kit, 4.C. Footloose Man, 6.D. Rock & Scissors, 3 (inside chimney).E. Finger Ripping Good, 10 (S face).F. Ball Buster, 11.
